published_attributes.title: Introduction
published_attributes.serialized_body:
This course is designed to walk you through the basic areas of Bridge that you'll be using on a daily basis. Here is what you'll find in this short step-by-step guide:

  1. About Bridge
  2. Profile set-up
  3. One-on-one meetings (1on1 Agendas)
  4. Team meetings (Team Agendas)
  5. Feedback
  6. Face-to-face (Performance Conversation)
  7. Individual Goals
  8. Team Goals / Company Goals
  9. Skills
  10. Development Plan
  11. Learning

Have fun!

published_attributes.title: About Bridge
published_attributes.serialized_body:
Bridge is an Employee Development Platform that allows to align the previously dispersed processes such as: weeklies with the leader, face-to-faces, gathering feedback, goal setting, development planning and learning, among others.

The video below includes a quick overview of Bridge features.

blocks.text: Bridge is an Employee Development Platform that allows to align the previously dispersed processes such as: weeklies with the leader, face-to-faces, gathering feedback, goal setting, development planning and learning, among others.
The video below includes a quick overview of Bridge features.

published_attributes.title: Profile set-up
published_attributes.serialized_body: Setting up your profile and filling out essential information will allow you and other Netgurals to quickly access key information about the team.

blocks.text: Setting up your profile and filling out essential information will allow you and other Netgurals to quickly access key information about the team.

published_attributes.title: One-on-one meetings (1on1 Agendas)
published_attributes.serialized_body:
Netguru o3 meetings, a weekly or bi-weekly meeting with a leader, are called 1o1 Agendas in Bridge. This feature allows to keep notes and track the cadence of such meetings.

1. Create 1on1 Agenda (aka o3 notes).

2. Invite your team mate.

3. Add Agenda Items (talking points) and assign tasks to yourself or team mates. Once you go through the agenda, click the "Complete 1TO1" button.

4. In order to have another meeting click the "View Agenda" button.

4. In order to have another meeting click the "View Agenda" button.

published_attributes.title: Team Meetings (Group Agendas)
published_attributes.serialized_body:
Team meetings are called Group Agendas in Bridge work similarly to 1on1 Agendas.

To divide the Group Agenda among team members or larger topics you can create sections.

blocks.text: Team meetings are called Group Agendas in Bridge work similarly to 1on1 Agendas.

published_attributes.title: Feedback
published_attributes.serialized_body:
With Bridge you can not only give feedback but also nurture an active approach towards requesting feedback.

  1. Go to Me > Feedback and choose Request Feedback for start-stop-continue. Within this section you can point to the very specific aspect of your work or your behavior that you'd like to receive feedback on.
  2. This allows to pinpoint the exact areas that could use some improvement.

This allows to pinpoint the exact areas that could use some improvement.

published_attributes.title: Face-to-face (Performance Conversation)
published_attributes.serialized_body:
In order to have a Performance Conversation in Bridge, reach out to your leader who will create a Performance Conversation Agenda.

Once ready it will be visible for you to enter and edit.

blocks.text: In order to have a Performance Conversation in Bridge, reach out to your leader who will create a Performance Conversation Agenda.
Once ready it will be visible for you to enter and edit.

published_attributes.title: Individual Goals
published_attributes.serialized_body:
You can set your own goals in the Goals section of Bridge.

Also - all goals from your 1on1 Agendas or those added in the Focus Skills (see Development Plan) will also transfer here.

This is where you can access Team Goals and Company Goals to make sure your individual goals align with them.

published_attributes.title: Skills
published_attributes.serialized_body:
In your profile section you can add your skills:

  • the ones you want top develop
  • and the ones you can help with

Once you scroll down in your editable profile you'll find this:

published_attributes.title: Development Plan
published_attributes.serialized_body:
In the Development Plan section you set your development areas called Focus Skills. You can choose up to 3 Focus Skills per quarter (or longer if necessary).

Mind you, these are not the same as your general operational goals discussed previously, but you can add the operational goals to Focus Skills as elements of the development.

For each Focus Skill you can add: goals (new or existing), tasks or enroll into learning - from the Learning Library.

published_attributes.title: Learning
published_attributes.serialized_body:
All the learning content in Bridge you can find in the Learning section.

The My learning section contains the courses or trainings you have signed up for or that are mandatory and have been assigned to you.

Learner Library offers all available courses. To enroll choose "learn more" and then "enroll".

If you want to become an author reach out to the L&D Team.
